thread.title: Police confirm link on Tunisian terror attacks
thread.title_full: Police confirm link on Tunisian terror attacks

title: Police confirm link on Tunisian terror attacks
text:
Police confirm link on Tunisian terror attacks 6 August 2015 Source: Chedly Ben Ibrahim / Demotix / Press Association Images 
Scotland Yard has said the link was based on strong evidence but refused to add any further information. British police officers have been in the country assisting Tunisian authorities following the attack on the beach near Sousse on June 26. 
Tunisian authorities have arrested 150 people in connection to the most recent attack which saw a total of 38 people killed before the terrorist, a Tunisian named Seifeddine Rezgui, was killed by the police. 
A total of 15 of those arrested have since been charged with terrorism offences. 
The authorities have said that Rezgui was trained in neighbouring Libya at the same time as the two men who attacked the Bardo National Museum in March which saw 22 people killed, including one British woman. 
The coroner in the UK has been told about the link and British police continue to work with their Tunisian counterparts on both investigations.
